summary: Use this API to migrate a single image from an external site to Lazada site
description: Use this API to migrate a single image from an external site to Lazada site. Allowed image formats are JPG and PNG. The maximum size of an image file is 1MB.

common.name: app_key
common.description: Unique app ID issued by LAZADA Open Platform console when you apply for an app category

common.name: timestamp
common.description: The time stamp of the request e.g. 1517820392000 (which translates to 5 February 2018 08:46:32) with less than 7200s difference from UTC time

common.name: sign_method
common.description: The HMAC hash algorithm you are using to calculate your signature

request_examples.code:
client = LazopApiClient::Client.new(url, appkey, appSecret)
request = LazopApiClient::Request.new('/image/migrate')
request.add_api_parameter("payload", "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\" ?> <Request>     <Image>         <Url>http://pic4.nipic.com/20091217/3885730_124701000519_2.jpg</Url>     </Image> </Request>")
response = client.execute(request, accessToken)
puts response.success?
puts response.body

client = lazop.LazopClient(url, appkey ,appSecret)
request = lazop.LazopRequest('/image/migrate')
request.add_api_param('payload', '<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\" ?> <Request>     <Image>         <Url>http://pic4.nipic.com/20091217/3885730_124701000519_2.jpg</Url>     </Image> </Request>')
response = client.execute(request, access_token)
print(response.type)
print(response.body)

error_codes.description: The request URL is not valid.
The image URL is not supported.

error_codes.message: E303: The image is too large
error_codes.description: The size of the migrated image exceeds the 1M limit.

error_codes.message: E901: The request is too frequent, or the requested functionality is temporarily disabled.
error_codes.description: Failed to return the requested data due to high calling frequency or disabled functionality. Please try again later.
The server could not download the image from the link, please check that your link responds with an HTTP status code of 200 and that your image meets the requirements of this document
The server could not download the image from the link, please check that your link responds with an HTTP status code of 200 and that your image meets the requirements of this document
Please check that the payload is documented and conforms to the XML formatting requirements. If you have URLs with “&” in them, then please use Cdata tags to avoid XML parsing problems.
Please check if the URL of the image you provided is externally accessible or if the HTTP status code of the response is 200.
Please make sure your image size is less than 5000*5000px and file size is less than 3145728B.
Please check if the http status code in response to the image link in the request is 200, and check if your image meets the requirements based on this document.

Please check that you are uploading a JPG or PGN image that meets the requirements, and if you are sure that there is nothing wrong with the image but encounter this error frequently, please create a ticket to inquire about it.
